Where things stand, after Powell's written testimony has been released and before the Q&A starts.

tl:dr, Trump appointees Waller and Bowman are suggesting a July cut. Powell is reiterating "no."
Will the July FOMC meeting see at least two dissenters?

Effectively, it's a bet that the ceasefire will hold through July.

Bettors are optimistic that it will hold.
---
Remember, we view betting markets as the summation of all understanding of an issue distilled into one probability.  It's what we think is going to happen, not what will happen.

It's like asking an expert for their best estimate. Can it be wrong? Yes, but no more so than experts on TV. But this expert is far more objective. Bettors want to be right because that is how they make money, not make political statements.

As new information becomes available, these bettors will adjust their outlook.

From @biancoresearch: "Are we witnessing the BEGINNING of a Fed mutiny, led by two Trump appointees, Bowman and Waller, & driven by Trump's persistent demands for rate cuts? Will Powell squash dissenters? Does this type of mutiny (Fed style) give Trump an opening to fire Powell?"

nytimes.com/live/2025/06/23/‚Ä¶

Iran Confirms Cease-Fire With Israel After Trump Announcement
Crude oil is also taking the ceasefire seriously. It has collapsed by ~18% in 24 hours, one of its biggest 24-hour declines in history.
The market is taking the ceasefire seriously. Betting on the Strait of Hormuz closing is at its lowest levels.

The result of today's missile attack against a US base in Qatar has oil plunging and the fear of Iran closing the Strait of Hormuz collapsing (chart).

Markets are concluding that Iran is incapable of closing the Strait, and are reacting in kind.
Cuomo is now bouncing back

Three-day tick chart of crude oil. 

Quite the reversal, down over 5% from the Asian opening last night.

Is the market not worried about Iranian-driven supply disruptions? Is it saying the Iranians cannot close the Strait of Hormuz?

Jay Powell testifies in Congress this week facing

‚Ä¢ Unprecedented public criticism from the president who wants big cuts to help finance the public debt

‚Ä¢ An unusual divide opening up inside the FOMC, where the two people pushing cuts are the two Trump appointees

‚Ä¢ A murky economic outlook with risks on both sides

‚Ä¢ An upcoming succession drama over who will take his job next year
Similar comments from @NickTimiraos

Another add to the above ...

Don't forget that Lutnick ripped Powell on Truth Social, and Senator Tommy Tuberville (R-AL) called for Powell to be fired.

The cumulative incoming might be having an effect.

Adding to above:

Is this the beginning of the "Shadow Fed," where Powell loses control of the FOMC to those who want his job?
---
Why should you care? 

Because it implies that Trump and political considerations, more than economic considerations, are driving monetary policy.

Are we witnessing the BEGINNING of a Fed mutiny, led by two Trump appointees, Bowman and Waller, and driven by Trump's persistent demands for rate cuts?

The chart below shows the probabilities of a July cut. It was just 8% right after Powell's presser last week. 

Then Waller spoke on Friday:
*FED'S WALLER: COULD CUT RATES AS EARLY AS JULY MEETING

Bowman early this morning
*FED'S BOWMAN: OPEN TO CUTTING RATES AS SOON AS JULY FOMC MEETING IF INFLATION PRESSURES STAY CONTAINED

Now it is 25% for a July cut, implying this meeting MIGHT BE in play.

Is everyone at the FOMC on the same page? Will Powell squash dissenters? If not, will the July meeting have several dissents? 

Does this type of mutiny (Fed style) give Trump an opening to fire Powell?

Are Waller and Bowman just angling to be Trump's pick for the next Fed Chairman?

Powell testifies before the House tomorrow (Wednesday in the Senate), and unity on monetary policy, and allowing diverse opinions (and votes) has risen to the top of the issues he needs to address.

---

Postscript: Another person angling to be the next Fed Chairman also weighed in today.

*HASSETT: WALLER, TRUMP ARE RIGHT ABOUT INTEREST RATES

Another person is trying out for Powell's job.

*HASSETT: WALLER, TRUMP ARE RIGHT ABOUT INTEREST RATES
